newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Helix to boost exploration budget.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Helix to boost exploration budget.

text.p: Helix Resources Ltd said it was boosting its exploration budget in the Gawler Craton region to A$1.1 million per month from A$700,000 but did not think it would be able to keep pace on results with market expectations.

Managing director Rob Mosig told a briefing on Thursday night the company believed the acceleration in exploration was necessary because it regarded the South Australian area as having the potential to produce a major series of gold finds.

However, acknowedging Helix's share price has slumped on market disappointment with recent results after its earlier dramatic rise, Mosig said Helix's Tunkillia anomaly was likely to produce mixed results.

"It is very difficult to produce results, when looking for natural things such as an orebody, which are going to be perfect all the time," he told the briefing hosted by local brokerage firm Day Cutten.
"Not every drill line will go over the hot spots," he said.
"I do not believe we will be able to keep up to market expectations," he said.
Nevertheless Mosig said Helix would not share, joint venture or swap its Gawler ground.
The company had A$16-17 million available for exploration and its next results could be available in three to four weeks or timed to coincide with its annual meeting on April 24, he said.
Major gold miner Acacia Resources Ltd last month bought a 17.4 percent strategic stake in Helix, citing the exciting prospectivity of the Gawler Craton.
